qas.question: What is another term for mutualism?
Of what duration are symbiotic relationships?
What is a term for a relationship between individuals of the same species where both individuals benefit?
Who restricts the definition of symbiosis to indicate both obligate and facultative concurrently?
What time span involving gradual biochemical contact can properly be considered symbiotic?
What must interspecies reciprocal altruism be considered to fit the the definition of symbiosis?
What mutualistic relationships fit the the definition of symbiosis?

context: <b2_0>Mutualism<b2_0/> or <a0_0>interspecies reciprocal altruism<a0_0/> is a relationship between individuals of different species where both individuals benefit. In general, only <a1_0><b4_0>lifelong<b4_0/><a1_0/> interactions involving close physical and biochemical contact can properly be considered symbiotic. Mutualistic relationships may be either <b6_0>obligate<b6_0/> for both species, obligate for one but <b5_0>facultative<b5_0/> for the other, or facultative for both. Many <b3_0>biologists<b3_0/> restrict the definition of symbiosis to close mutualist relationships.
